item.title: [help!] PHP Different Sessions for Different Instances!
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

ok in PHP there is “$_SESSION” which is for using variables in multiple classes.

For example:

<?php
require_once("OtherClass.php");
class TOOL {
	function TOOL() {
		session_start();
		$_SESSION["tool"] = "llama" . rand(1, 10000);
		new OtherClass();
	}
}
?>
<?php
class OtherClass {
	function OtherClass() {
		session_start();
		echo $_SESSION["tool"];
	}
}
?>

(not sure if that works without errors but you get the idea :/)

that would set the $_SESSION variable “tool” to “llama + randomNumber()” in the class TOOL and echo it in OtherClass. This is all great and good right? But what if I need multiple instances of TOOL? One instance would overwrite another instances’ variable “$_SESSION[“tool”]” to a new variable.

Please Halp!

~Garghluxia
